ChicagoVPS *Labor Day Sale* $4.50/mo 4GB OpenVZ and more!

September 3, 2017 @ 8:00 pm, by Matt Zelasko


ChicagoVPS is back with some new deals for Labor Day! The below packages are discounted for the life of the service. Once these packages are gone, they’re gone so act quickly if you’re interested! Accepted payment methods are through PayPal, Credit Cards and Bitcoin. Servers will be setup manually once your payment has been made and the order reviewed, given that you don’t trigger any fraud extra protection measures at the payment gateways (expect to have your service turned over within 12 – 24 hours).

ChicagoVPS has a long history in the Low End Box market serving customers for many years and has been featured a bunch of times, having first been posted on Low End Box on October 16, 2010!

  • 2x vCPU
  • 30GB SSD (RAID-10) Disk Space
  • 2TB Bandwidth
  • 1Gbps Uplink
  • 1x IPv4

  • *LIMITED QUANTITY*

  • $35/yr – [Order Now]

Nick, the brand manager, and his team strive to provide 24/7 help desk technical support along with live chat and he’s indicated that he will be available to personally assist customers as needed so please feel free to send him a message over @ LowEndTalk. As usual, we suggest you read the Terms of Service before purchasing.

Network information

Buffalo, New York:
– 270,490 square foot gross; 23,000 square feet of datacenter space.
– Fully redundant native 10GE network consists of Telia, Hibernia and XO. CenturyLink, Fibertech, TW Telecom, and Time Warner Cable are onsite.
– 24/7/365 staffing with at least 2 techs.
– Buffalo datacenter facility is SSAE16 Type II certified ensuring that our processes and procedures meet or exceed the strictest of standards.
– Low latency and high throughput network access to North America and Europe.

ChicagoVPS is owned and operated by the same parent company as Low End Box and Low End Talk, ColoCrossing, so you can trust that your service will be reliable.
